page.title: 10 Fruit Farming (2)
page.content: Surprisingly for such a large farm there are only 75 permanent employees.Seasonal employment does figure in the farming year.Up to 200 employees are taken on between June and September.They will be local people, often mothers accompanied by young children.Arnolds sell their fruit to Sainsburys Supermarket chain as well as to the whole country on a wholesale basis.Their apples can be spotted in Sainsburys by the code A.There are 550 acres (223 hectares) of apple orchard. Every year about 20 acres are grubbed out.Winter wheat is sown after the grubbing out.The replanting of a new orchard takes place the following year.The roots of the young fruit trees are carefully ptotected from frost with a mulch of straw.The trees will be kept for between 20 and 60 years,depending on their type.
